sense.def:
Honour
je vedênje v skladu s svojimi zamislimi ali prepričanji, tako da nas drugi spoštujejo.

seg.quote: A debt is a thing of family honour.
He was able to withdraw from the battle with honour.

sense.def:
An honour
je posebna nagrada ali delo, dodeljeno neki osebi za tisto, kar je storila.

seg.quote: It was a richly deserved honour.
He is one of the most interesting people I have had the honour of meeting.
She did me the honour of attending my exhibition.

sense.def:
Honours
je vrsta univerzitetne diplome, ki je višje stopnje kot navadna diploma;

seg.quote: ...a first class honours degree in French.

sense.def:
To honour someone
pomeni nekoga javno pohvaliti ali mu podeliti medaljo za nekaj, kar je storil.

seg.quote: The people came to honour their leader.
In 1949, he was honoured with the Grand Cross.

sense.def:
To honour someone
pomeni tudi nekoga obravnavati s posebno pozornostjo in spoštovanjem.

seg.quote: When President Gorbachev lunches with the Queen today, he will become the first Soviet leader to be so honoured.

sense.def:
To honour an arrangement or promise
pomeni držati se dogovora ali obljube;

seg.quote: The government has solemn commitments and must honour them.

sense.def:
Če je nekaj organizirano
in honour of an event
, je to storjeno, da bi proslavili neki dogodek.

seg.quote: The ceremony was held in honour of the Queen's birthday.
